member.name: T:Sudoku.Data.CellStatus
member.summary: Represents a cell status.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.CellStatus.Empty
member.summary: Indicates that the cell is empty.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.CellStatus.Modifiable
member.summary: Indicates that the cell has already filled a value, but the value does not exist when the puzzle begins.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.CellStatus.Given
member.summary: Indicates that the cell has already filled a value, and the value does exist when the puzzle begins. In other words, the value is a given (or a hint, clue, etc.).

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.CellStatus.All
member.summary: Indicates all cases of cell statuses.
member.remarks: You had better use this field on cases when processing the bitwise operations in a sudoku . This field is not used to process cell status comparison.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Data.FullGridMap
member.summary: Encapsulates a binary series of candidate status table consisting of 729 bits, where bit (1) is for the cell having digit, and the bit (0) is for empty cell. Sometimes for other usages.
member.remarks: This data structure use at least 144 bytes, which has outnumbered the number of the threshold of value types via Microsoft C# language designation team (Every instance of value type should be no more than 64 bytes). Therefore, we should use instead of this data structure as much as possible.

member.summary: Indicates an empty instance (making no changes).

member.summary: All bits map.

member.summary: All bits map.

member.summary: All bits map.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Data.FullGridMap.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes an instance with the specified candidate offset. This will set all bits of all peers of this candidate. Another value indicates whether this initialization will set the bit of itself.
member.param:
A value indicating whether this initialization will set the bit of itself. If the value is , it will be equivalent to below:
var map = new FullGridMap(offset) { [offset] = false };

member.name: T:Sudoku.Data.Grid
member.summary: Encapsulates a basic sudoku grid.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.Grid.EmptyString
member.summary: Indicates the empty grid string.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.Grid.Empty
member.summary: Indicates an empty grid, where all values are zero.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.Grid._masks
member.summary: Binary masks of all cells.

remarks.para: This array stores binary representation of decimals.

There are 81 cells in a sudoku grid, so this data structure uses an array of size 81. Each element is a value, where the lower 9 bits indicates if the digit 1 to 9 exists or not. If the value is (i.e. binary is for 1), this digit will not be exist. The higher 3 bits indicates the cell status. The cases are below:
0b001 (1) The cell is .
0b010 (2) The cell is .
0b100 (4) The cell is .

member.name: F:Sudoku.Data.Grid._initialMasks
member.summary: Same as , but this field stores the all masks at the initial grid. The field will not be modified until this instance destructs.

member.summary: Get cell status for a value.

member.summary: Get the default list.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.GridFormatter.Placeholder
member.summary: The place holder.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.GridFormatter.WithModifiables
member.summary: Indicates the output should be with modifiable values.

summary.para: Indicates the output should be with candidates. If the output is single line, the candidates will indicate the candidates-have-eliminated before the current grid status; if the output is multi-line, the candidates will indicate the real candidate at the current grid status.

If the output is single line, the output will append the candidates value at the tail of the string in ':candidate list'. In addition, candidates will be represented as 'digit', 'row offset' and 'column offset' in order.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.GridFormatter.TreatValueAsGiven
member.summary: Indicates the output will treat modifiable values as given ones. If the output is single line, the output will remove all plus marks '+'. If the output is multi-line, the output will use '<digit>' instead of '*digit*'.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.GridFormatter.SubtleGridLines
member.summary: Indicates whether need to handle all grid outlines while outputting. See file "How to use 'Grid' class.md" for more information.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Data.GridParsingType
member.summary: Represents a grid parsing type.

summary.para: Indicates the susser format, which means all grid values will be displayed in one line with empty cell character '0' or '.'.
Indicates the pencil marked grid (PM grid), which means all grid candidates will be displayed using a table.
Indicates the pencil marked grid (PM grid), which means all grid candidates will be displayed using a table. In addition, all single digit will be treated as a given digit.
Indicates the table format, which means all grid values will be displayed using a table with empty cell character '0' or '.'.

member.summary: Indicates the grid has already solved. If the value is , the grid is solved; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets a digit into a cell.
member.param: The cell offset you want to get or set.
member.value: The digit you want to set. This value should be between 0 and 8. In addition, if your input is -1, the candidate mask in this cell will be re-computed. If your input is none of them above, this indexer will do nothing.
member.returns: An value indicating the result. If the current cell does not have a digit (i.e. The cell is ), The value will be -1.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Data.IReadOnlyGrid.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets a candidate existence case with a value.
member.value: The case you want to set. means that this candidate does not exist in this current sudoku grid; otherwise, .

member.returns: This array. All elements are between 0 to 9, where 0 means the cell is now.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Drawing.View
member.summary: Encapsulates a view when displaying the information on forms.
Initializes an instance with information.
member.param: The list of pairs of identifier and cell offset.
The list of pairs of identifier and candidate offset.
The list of pairs of identifier and region offset.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Drawing.View.CellOffsets
member.summary: All cell offsets.
member.remarks: This property is a list of pairs of identifier and cell offsets, where the identifier is an value that can tell all cell offsets' colors.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Drawing.View.CandidateOffsets
member.summary: All candidate offsets.
member.remarks: This property is a list of pairs of identifier and candidate offsets, where the identifier is an value that can tell all cell offsets' colors.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Drawing.View.RegionOffsets
member.summary: All region offsets.
member.remarks: This property is a list of pairs of identifier and region offsets, where the identifier is an value that can tell all cell offsets' colors.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Drawing.View.LinkMasks
member.summary: All link masks.
member.remarks:
This property is a list of masks. All mask is regarded as 22 bits, 10 bits for base candidate offset, another 10 bits for target candidate offset and 2 bits for link type, where the value is:
0b00 -> . 0b01 -> . 0b10 -> . 0b11 -> .

member.name: T:System.ICloneable`1
member.summary: Supports cloning, which creates a new instance of a class with the same value as an existing instance. Different than , the cloneation has the same type with this existing instance.
member.typeparam: The type of this instance. This type should be only a class because the cloning operation is needed only in reference types, while the value types will be passed by value, at this time all value members (fields and properties) will be copied one by one.

member.name: M:System.ICloneable`1.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new instance that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: The instance having the same type with the base one. Because the type is used and defined before using this method, so the return type will be never .

member.name: T:System.IUndoable
member.summary: Provides a undo-able data structure.

member.name: M:System.IUndoable.Undo
member.summary: To undo the step.

member.name: M:System.IUndoable.Redo
member.summary: To redo the step.

member.name: T:System.Externals.Throwing
member.summary: Provides operations for throwing exceptions.

summary.para: Indicates an exception throwing when the case is impossible in switch expressions or switch-case clauses.
This property will be used as a placeholder when expressions generate a warning (CS8509).

member.name: M:System.Externals.Throwing.ImpossibleCaseWithMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates an exception throwing when the case is impossible in switch expressions or switch-case clauses.

member.name: M:System.Externals.Throwing.ParsingError``1(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates an exception throwing when the parsing is failed.

member.name: M:System.Externals.Throwing.FormatErrorWithMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Indicates an exception throwing when the format string is error.
member.param: The name of format string parameter.
